tweets.text:
Exciting things happening to improve the outlook for the critically endangered freshwater mussel, from habitat improvement to releasing juveniles reared @freshwaterbio Mussel Ark. Thanks to @unitedutilities  

Good news story to go with your morning cuppa: https://t.co/DGT5l3XQtY

tweets.text: @GroundwaterMike Recharge complete, aquifers full & discharging as baseflow to rivers. #WhenItsFullItsFull

It's illegal to dump sewage sludge in the sea, but this farmer sprays it on his fields every year, & it then gets washed into watercourses, & we're only 3 miles from the sea - so how does that work then? ü§î https://t.co/Kj40GNckd0

In 2015 #StormDesmond & #StormEva caused devastating flooding in #Lancashire 

In 2020 we are celebrating the defences in the Caton Road and Aldrens Lane areas of Lancaster reaching completion & better protecting more than 170 homes & 1,100 businesses ahead of winter this year! https://t.co/eFCurvqxZN

We don‚Äôt do ‚Äòopenings‚Äô for new #flood defences, rather today it was a closing to celebrate new Caton Rd #Lancaster #flood defences being fully operational thanks to #teamwork from all involved. @LancasterCC @EnvAgencyNW @esif1420england @VolkerStevinUK @_erica_lewis @CatSmithMP https://t.co/iUNn8HK5uo

tweets.text:
Christmas stocking - we've released 26,000 fish into North East rivers and stillwaters to give numbers a boost. 

The festive release saw young fish released in Northumberland, County Durham and Teesside.

Read more: https://t.co/l5WCOOM2Zo

#Christmas #fish #water https://t.co/SnUDgm1ISH

tweets.text: @FinnertyLynne @jnsweeneytweets @RBKingston @sleighbayley we seem to have this daft thing where we can only ask them to leave then they come back again. John knows more. sorry for butting in on something it‚Äôs not clear you obviously understood.
We're keeping an eye out for Wandle pollution and have reported this incident in the parallel channel at Bennett's Hole Local Nature Reserve yesterday to @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/EL54rWZ0UT

Just received this from @EnvAgency

"...current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use WITHIN EXISTING LICENSED VOLUMES will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/1mnOuVTXt7

Just finished a busy week as flood incident duty officer on 24/7 call. No flooding to deal with but our ever reliable field teams attended pump station alarms in the middle of the night, cleared grids on River Eau and shut gates at Torksey lock üëç #TeamEA @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/jYYs5NjaIf

urls.title: River Thames Conditions
urls.description: Welcome to the Environment Agency's online River Thames conditions update service which displays our current advice to river users. We display warning boards at our locks to inform river users of conditions that may make navigating difficult and dangerous. This page shows our current advice for each reach of the river between Cricklade and Teddington. We will update this information regularly when warning boards are being displayed at locks and as river conditions change. Upstream of St John's Lock No

tweets.text: High tide at Mevagissey this morning. Approx 450mm of additional sea level due to surge from the weather & wave action onto the South coast.  Great to see most properties had heeded @EnvAgency flood warnings and installed their flood boards to stop the sea entering the buildings https://t.co/4mbWArOY9E

A doctoral student looking at relative corruption in the healthcare systems of the UK and Nigeria told us things are actually better there.
